description.narrative: MWRAF 2016-2018 is a program funding. The strategic plan has four strategic goals. This program is mainly focusing on two program goals 1)To promote Social Justice and Gender Equity for Democratic Culture 2)To rebuilding relationships, networks across Ethnic Lines for Social Cohesion and Peace and Stability. The effects of the war had negative impact on the victims, especially women. Most importantly, the re-building of community relations has not been progressing satisfactorily and had an adverse impact on community relationships. These outcomes had changes mutual mistrust as communities blamed each other and these perceptions of mistrust and discrimination are widespread, and caused further damage to amicable reconciliation. Objectives; Strengthen Women and Women’s Organizations to promote space to voice their Rights and Equal participation; Support Women’s Groups/Networks to increase economic empowerment; Ending Violence Against Women; to strengthen and enhance support mechanisms (institutions, religious and community leaders); to strengthen and support the community structures and to create and support networks towards reconciliation and co-existence. The aims to enable marginalized women and address the gender aspects of violence, conflict and would envisage closing economic gaps for women. Expected; empowered women federation to raise the issues of women; strengthened forum to support and voice of migrant workers; empowered Muslim and Tamil women groups to address the issues of cultural and social constraints of women; strengthened mechanism and support network for addressing violence against women. Main activities: facilitating and enhancing the capacity of institutions - Batticaloa Women’s Federation and promote activities towards the building of a strong foundation of leadership skills, contribute to post conflict transition by collaborating with institutions and organizations at village and district. Thematic focus on Human rights, Gender equality.
This project mainly contributes to results within Economic empowerment of women. Results will be reported later in the Global Civsam grant period 2016-2020
